intro: Androsace spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved wintergreen, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in cool, moist environments such as forest floors and alpine meadows. Its leaves are usually broad and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Androsace spathulata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded conditions.
